title: Copa de Honor Cousenier
text:
The Copa de Honor Cousenier was an international <a href="association%20football">football</a> club competition which was played 13 times between representatives of the <a href="Argentine%20Football%20Association">Argentina</a> and <a href="Uruguayan%20Football%20Association">Uruguay</a> associations between 1905 and 1920.
History.
The trophy was donated by "E. Cusenier Fils Auné & Cie.", a <a href="France">French</a> <a href="liqueur">liqueur</a> company that had installed a factory in <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a> in the 1890s, giving its name to the competition. Initially, the cup was set to be played between representatives of AFA, AUF and <a href="Liga%20Rosarina%20de%20Football">Liga Rosarina</a>.
The format of the cup consisted in a final between the last champions of <a href="Copa%20de%20Honor%20Municipalidad%20de%20Buenos%20Aires">Argentine Copa de Honor</a> and <a href="Copa%20de%20Honor%20%28Uruguay%29">Uruguayan Copa de Honor</a>. If necessary, a second match was played. It was similar to <a href="Tie%20Cup">Tie Cup</a> but the final games were played at <a href="Montevideo">Montevideo</a> instead of <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a>. The first edition was played in 1905 and the last took place in 1920.
List of champions.
Finals.
The following list includes all the editions of the cup. All the final games were held in Montevideo.
